document_data.name: High Ice
document_data.races: [[Snow elf]]s, [[Glacier snake]]s, [[ice jack]]s, [[ice toad]]s, [[troll|ice trolls]], [[mammoth]]s, [[remorhaz]], [[snow cloaker]]s, [[snow snake]]s, [[white pudding]]s, [[winter wolf|winter wolves]], [[yeti]]s
document_data.mainbody: The '''High Ice''' was a desolate monster-infested glacier, found directly north of the [[Anauroch]] desert, that had been extended from its original size by the magic of the [[phaerimm]].
document_data.Geography: The western edges of the High Ice gave way to the [[Frozen Sea]], a frozen desert where part of the [[Narrow Sea]] once stood.<ref>
document_data.History:
The [[Netherese]] put considerable effort in constructing [[mythallar]]s along strategic points in order to prevent the ever-expanding glacier from encroaching upon the [[Narrow Sea]], the primary route through which their ships traveled. When their empire fell in [[-339 DR]] the mythallars stopped functioning, allowing the glacier to continue its advance and over hundreds of years freeze over it entirely by [[1 DR]]..

In [[-329 DR]], members of [[Clan Shattered Shield]] traveled east through the High Ice, fleeing from the [[slaying slumber.|slaying slumber]] plague.

In [[1372 DR]] the [[Shadovar]] began using [[shadow magic]] to melt large portions of the High Ice in an effort to make Anauroch fertile, causing widespread disruption of climate and weather systems throughout [[Faerûn]]. Eventually, their efforts were thwarted.

Notable Locations.[[Bhaulaea]]: Buried within glacial ice in the western reaches of the glacier, this ruin was once a [[sarrukh]] city of the [[Isstosseffifil]] empire, but was abandoned in the midst of their war with the phaerimm. Only one section of the city remains well preserved, housing a ''[[portal]]'' to the ruins of [[Ss’yin’tia’saminass]].
Notable Locations.[[Choshein]]: The ruins of an ancient, subterranean [[Jhothûn]] city that was destroyed by the [[Netherese]] and later used by them briefly as a colony.{{Cite web/Perilous Gateways/Portals of the Frozen Wastes: Jhothûn}}
Notable Locations.[[Smokeholes]]:
An area of large, round vents where hot cloud-like plumes of steam spewed out from underground flows of lava known as the [[Caverns of Burning Ice]]. Many [[gnome]]s and [[dwarf]]s were known to mount expeditions down into those treacherous caverns, braving their noxious gases and [[salamander]]s for the veins of rare ores fabled to lie within.

Nearby were a number of grottos, warmed by smaller vents, that dragons in the region were known to frequent. Strangely, [[Red dragon|Red]], [[brass dragon|brass]], [[topaz dragon|topaz]], and [[blue dragon|blue]] dragons were known to be found here, while throughout the rest of the High Ice [[white dragon]]s were the the predominantly encountered species.
Notable Locations.Rift of Stars: Otherwise known as the "Road of Gems" or "River of Gems," was a massive narrow glacial rift that stretched on for miles and reached down into stony depths adorned with deposits of [[beljuril]]s, [[amaratha|amarathas]], [[rubies]], and other precious gems. The rift's name was derived from the dazzling spectacle of lights that the beljurils display at night. Many mining expeditions have been made to the rifts, inspiring a plethora of ballads and leading to the creation of many small caves that provide shelter.
Notable Locations.Llashloch, The Lake of Ice: A large glacial rift, said to resemble a bent human arm, that has been hollowed out by hot springs. The steaming lake below was teeming with wind-sculpted ice floes, the hot springs unable to completely remove the ice. [[octopus|White-skinned octopuses]] and [[snow cloaker]]s were known to lurk in these depths.
Notable Locations.Taglorlar: Otherwise known as the ''"Beth of Taglo"'', Taglorlar was a notable line of sharp rock hills that rose from the [[Plain of Standing Stones]] and spanned the northeastern part of the region. The exact number of rocks was unknown, but many traveled across them like a road or used them as shelter. Much like other notable locations in the region, creatures often lurked along the rocks in hopes of ambushing travelers.
Notable Locations.Untrivvin:
A mountain peak largely inhabited by yetis and believed by many people to be haunted. Its name was derived from an extinct language and roughly translates as "singing rock," based on the fact that it occasionally rang like a bell. The sound and the haunting myth that surrounded this mountain both originated from the mountain's subterranean inhabitants, the [[tomb tapper]]s. The ringing was caused by the mountain's interior being a honeycombed structure, carved smoothly, with chambers and halls that were all curved.

Wise men long claimed that there were rare ore and gems to be found within the depths of Untrivvin, but no one had ever returned from it with proof.

document_data.Inhabitants: Despite it being an obvious place for [[frost giant]]s to lair, no true giant had entered the High Ice ever since a tribe of them attempted to enslave the local [[crystal dragon]]s and were massacred in the process.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
Legends tell of the northernmost part of the High Ice in actuality being a huge white pudding, hundreds of feet in diameter that doesn't move, simply waiting for creatures to come along and be devoured by it.

According to [[Ibn Al'Arif]], when he was traveling through this region a stranger claimed that the salamanders within the Smokeholes were allegedly guarding something by order of a powerful entity.

Ancient Netherese ruins were said to lay well-preserved within the ice, protected by restless spirits and various monsters who have come to inhabit them. [[Runlatha]] was one of these cities, but is buried so deep beneath the ice that no one has been able to access it.

[[Augaurath]], an ancient white dragon that ruled over all other dragons in the region, was rumored to be worshiped as a god by other creatures that inhabited the High Ice. Such as the yeti, winter wolves, and even a few semi-intelligent remorhaz.

[[Snow elf|Snow elves]], an arctic off-shoot of the [[elven]] race, was rumored to inhabit the High Ice.{{Cite dragon/236/The Seldarine Revisited}}
